attributes.action:
Standardise the age when people can
 get a bus pass across the UK to 60.
attributes.additional_details: Apart from being very unfair that getting a bus pass after the age of 60 depends on where you live. It makes no financial or environmental sense. Buses are not fully utilised during the working day – therefore it would cost ‘nothing’ to allow a pensioner take up an unoccupied seat. And it could also reduce pollution, if pensioner does not use a car but uses a bus instead (assuming they have access to a car).
attributes.background: It is unfair that parts of the UK become eligible at 60 whereas other people have to wait until state pension age.
